DataElement.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Cancer Prevention Trial New Recurrence Diagnosis Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to the diagnosis of a new or recurrent malignant neoplasm within a clinical trial that studies ways of reducing the risk of getting cancer.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Cancer Prevention Trial New Recurrence Diagnosis
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the diagnosis of a new or recurrent malignant neoplasm within a clinical trial that studies ways of reducing the risk of getting cancer.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredName: Cancer Prevention Trial New Recurrence Diagnosis
Property.preferredDefinition: RAEB: Clinical evaluation of interventions for inhibiting the occurrence of cancer.:Having no previous example or precedent or parallel; of a kind not seen before.:To occur again.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Concepts.definition: Clinical trials that study ways of reducing the risk of getting cancer.
Having no previous example or precedent or parallel; of a kind not seen before.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has the patient had a diagnos
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a diagnosis of new or recurrent cancer as defined in Section 7.3a of the protocol?
